Package se.arkalix.dto.binary

Interface BinaryReader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ByteArrayReader
    public interface BinaryReader
    Represents an object useful for reading binary data.

    Apart from keeping track of whatever source of bytes is being read, the reader is also assumed to have an internal read offset that is incremented whenever bytes are read.

      Gets byte at the given offset without incrementing the internal read offset.

      Gets bytes at the given offset without incrementing the internal read offset.
      byte peekByte()
      Gets byte at the internal read offset, without incrementing the offset.
      int readableBytes()  
      byte readByte()
      Gets byte at the internal read offset and increments that offset.
      default byte readByteOrZero()
      Gets byte at the internal read offset and increments that offset, unless there is nothing more to read, in which case 0 is returned.

      Reads bytes into target.

      Increments the internal read offset by n.

    • Method Detail

      • readOffset

        int readOffset()
        Returns:
        Index of next byte to read.

      • readOffset

        void readOffset​(int offset)
        Parameters:
        offset - New read offset.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If given offset is less than 0 or larger than the number of readable bytes.

      • readableBytes

        int readableBytes()
        Returns:
        Number of bytes currently left to read.

      • getByte

        byte getByte​(int offset)
        Gets byte at the given offset without incrementing the internal read offset.
        Parameters:
        offset - Position of byte to read.
        Returns:
        Read byte.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If given offset is less than 0 or larger than the number of readable bytes.

      • getBytes

        void getBytes​(int offset,
              byte[] target)
        Gets bytes at the given offset without incrementing the internal read offset. The number of acquired bytes will be the same as the length of target.
        Parameters:
        offset - Position of byte to read.
        target - Receiver of read bytes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If given offset is less than 0 or larger than the number of readable bytes minus the length of target.

      • getBytes

        void getBytes​(int offset,
              byte[] target,
              int targetOffset,
              int length)
        Gets bytes at the given offset without incrementing the internal read offset. The number of acquired bytes will be the same as the length of target.
        Parameters:
        offset - Position of byte to read.
        target - Receiver of read bytes.
        targetOffset - Offset from beginning of target at which the received bytes will be written.
        length - The number of bytes to read into target.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If offset, targetOffset or length are negative, out of bounds, or there are less than length bytes left to read.

      • peekByte

        byte peekByte()
        Gets byte at the internal read offset, without incrementing the offset.
        Returns:
        Byte at the internal read offset.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If there is no byte left to peek.

      • readByte

        byte readByte()
        Gets byte at the internal read offset and increments that offset.
        Returns:
        Byte at the internal read offset.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If there is no byte left to read.

      • readByteOrZero

        default byte readByteOrZero()
        Gets byte at the internal read offset and increments that offset, unless there is nothing more to read, in which case 0 is returned.
        Returns:
        Byte at the internal read offset or 0.

      • readBytes

        default void readBytes​(byte[] target)
        Reads bytes into target. The number of read bytes will be the same as the length of target.
        Parameters:
        target - Receiver of read bytes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If less than target.length bytes are available for reading.

      • readBytes

        void readBytes​(byte[] target,
               int targetOffset,
               int length)
        Reads length bytes into target, beginning at targetOffset.
        Parameters:
        target - Receiver of read bytes.
        targetOffset - Position in target at which to start adding read bytes.
        length - Number of bytes to read into target.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If targetOffset or length are negative, out of bounds, or there are less than length bytes left to read.

      • skipByte

        default void skipByte()
        Increments the internal read offset by 1 without getting the byte at the current offset.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If there is no byte to skip.

      • skipBytes

        void skipBytes​(int n)
        Increments the internal read offset by n.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If there are less than n bytes left to skip.
